Jokowi Lantik Sembilan Anggota Komisi Kejaksaan
01 Nov 2019, 07:01 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR).- Presiden Joko Widodo melantik sembilan orang anggota Komisi Kejaksaan periode 2019-2023. Pelantikan tersebut berdasarkan Keputusan Presiden 62/M tertanggal 18 Oktober 2019.
"Demi Allah saya bersumpah bahwa saya akan setia kepada Undang-Undang Dasar Negara Republik Indonesia Tahun 1945 serta akan menjalankan segala peraturan perundang-undangan dengan selurus-lurusnya demi darmabakti saya kepada bangsa dan negara. Bahwa saya dalam menjalankan tugas jabatan akan menjunjung tinggi etika jabatan bekerja dengan sebaik-baiknya dan dengan penuh rasa tanggung jawab," kata Presiden Joko Widodo saat membimbing pengucapan sumpah jabatan di Istana Negara Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara.
Nama-nama komisioner Komisi Kejaksaan periode 2019-2023 adalah sebagai berikut:
1. Barita LH Simanjuntak (Ketua merangkap anggota) dari unsur pemerintah2. Babul Khoir (Wakil Ketua merangkap anggota) dari unsur pemerintah3. Witono (anggota) dari unsur pemerintah4. Sri Harijati (anggota) dari unsur masyarakat5. Apong Herlina (anggota) dari unsur masyarakat6. Resi Anna Napitupulu (anggota) dari unsur masyarakat7. Muhammad Ibnu Mazjah (anggota) dari unsur masyarakat8. Bambang Widarto (anggota) dari unsur masyarakat9. Bhatara Ibnu Reza (anggota) dari unsur masyarakat
Adapun tugas Komisi Kejaksaaan adalah melakukan pengawasan, pemantauan, dan penilaian terhadap kinerja Jaksa dan pegawai Kejaksaan dalam melaksanakan tugas kedinasannya.
Melakukan pengawasan, pemantauan, dan penilaian terhadap sikap dan perilaku Jaksa dan pegawai Kejaksaan baik di dalam maupun di luar tugas kedinasan.
Melakukan pemantauan dan penilaian atas kondisi organisasi, kelengkapan sarana dan prasarana, serta sumber daya manusia di lingkungan Kejaksaan.
Menyampaikan masukan kepada Jaksa Agung atas hasil pengawasan, pemantauan, dan penilaian sebagaimana tersebut huruf a, huruf b, dan huruf c untuk ditindaklanjuti.
Selain itu, wewenang Komisi Kejaksaan yakni menerima laporan masyarakat tentang perilaku Jaksa dan pegawai Kejaksaan dalam melaksanakan tugas baik di dalam maupun di luar kedinasan.
Kemudian meminta informasi dari badan pemerintah, organisasi, atau anggota masyarakat berkaitan dengan kondisi dan kinerja di lingkungan Kejaksaan atas dugaan pelanggaran peraturan kedinasan Kejaksaan maupun berkaitan dengan perilaku Jaksa dan pegawai Kejaksaan di dalam atau di luar kedinasan.
Memanggil dan meminta keterangan kepada Jaksa dan pegawai Kejaksaan sehubungan dengan perilaku dan/atau dugaan pelanggaran peraturan kedinasan Kejaksaan.
Meminta informasi kepada badan di lingkungan Kejaksaan berkaitan dengan kondisi organisasi, personalia, sarana, dan prasarana.
Menerima masukan dari masyarakat tentang kondisi organisasi, kelengkapan sarana, dan prasarana serta sumber daya manusia di lingkungan Kejaksaan.
Membuat laporan, rekomendasi, atau saran yang berkaitan dengan perbaikan dan penyempurnaan organisasi serta kondisi lingkungan Kejaksaan, atau penilaian terhadap kinerja dan perilaku Jaksa dan pegawai Kejaksaan kepada Jaksa Agung dan Presiden.***

Jokowi Appoints Nine Members of the Prosecutors' Commission
Nov 01 2019, 07:01 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR) .- President Joko Widodo inaugurated nine members of the Prosecutors' Commission in the 2019-2023 period. The inauguration was based on Presidential Decree 62 / M dated October 18, 2019.
"By Allah, I swear that I will be loyal to the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia and will carry out all laws and regulations as straightforwardly as possible for my service to the nation and the state. That in carrying out my duties, I will uphold the ethics of office work as well as possible and with a full sense of responsibility, "said President Joko Widodo while guiding the oath of office at the Jakarta State Palace, Friday, November 1, 2019, as reported by the Antara News Agency.
The names of the commissioners of the Prosecutorial Commission 2019-2023 are as follows:
1. Barita LH Simanjuntak (Chair and concurrent member) from government elements2. Babul Khoir (Deputy Chairperson and member) from government elements3. Witono (member) from government elements4. Sri Harijati (member) from the community element5. Apong Herlina (member) from the community element6. Receipt Anna Napitupulu (member) from the community element7. Muhammad Ibnu Mazjah (member) from the elements of society8. Bambang Widarto (member) from the community element9. Bhatara Ibnu Reza (member) from the community element
The task of the Prosecutors 'Commission is to supervise, monitor and evaluate the performance of Prosecutors and Prosecutors' Office staff in carrying out their official duties.
Supervise, monitor, and evaluate the attitudes and behavior of prosecutors and prosecutors' offices both inside and outside of official duties.
Monitoring and evaluating the condition of the organization, the completeness of facilities and infrastructure, and human resources in the Prosecutor's Office.
Submitting input to the Attorney General for the results of supervision, monitoring, and evaluation as referred to in letter a, letter b, and letter c to be followed up.
In addition, the Prosecutor's Commission's authority is to receive reports from the public about the behavior of Prosecutors and Prosecutors' Officers in carrying out their duties both inside and outside the service.
Then request information from government agencies, organizations, or community members relating to the conditions and performance in the Prosecutor's Office for alleged violations of the Prosecutor's official regulations or related to the behavior of Prosecutors and Prosecutors' offices inside or outside the Office.
Summon and request information from Prosecutors and Prosecutors' employees in relation to the behavior and / or alleged violations of the Prosecutor's office rules.
Request information from agencies within the Prosecutor's Office relating to the condition of the organization, personnel, facilities and infrastructure.
Receive input from the public about the condition of the organization, the completeness of facilities, and infrastructure as well as human resources in the Prosecutor's Office.
Make a report, recommendation, or suggestion relating to the improvement and improvement of the organization and the environment of the Prosecutor's Office, or an assessment of the performance and behavior of Prosecutors and Prosecutors' Attorney General to the Attorney General and the President. ***
